info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 4:47PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Hancock, southeastern Van Buren, southern Lee, southeastern Scotland and Clark Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 447 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Donnellson to 9 miles east of Colony. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Donnellson around 455 PM CDT. Franklin around 500 PM CDT. New Boston around 505 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Montrose, Fort Madison, Nauvoo and Niota. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
